thread.title: Anne Frank Center Commends Pence for Visit to Vandalized Cemetery After Criticisms of Trump
thread.title_full: Anne Frank Center Commends Pence for Visit to Vandalized Cemetery After Criticisms of Trump

author: Josh Feldman
title: Anne Frank Center Commends Pence for Visit to Vandalized Cemetery After Criticisms of Trump
text:
Anne Frank Center Commends Pence for Visit to Vandalized Cemetery After Criticisms of Trump by Josh Feldman | 7:00   
— The Situation Room (@CNNSitRoom) February 22, 2017 
The Anne Frank Center for Mutual Respect had some particularly critical words for President Trump yesterday on the subject of anti-Semitism, but today the center praised Vice President Mike Pence for his visit to a Jewish cemetery that was recently vandalized. 
During a planned speech in Missouri today, the vice president condemned the vandalism and acts of hatred and anti-Semitism. 
Then he visited the cemetery itself and not only spoke out against hate there again, but helped out the clean-up efforts. VP Pence and Gov Greitens also pitch in for a few minutes to help clean up the desecrated cemetery. pic.twitter.com/DcGnqfZyXW 
— Mark Knoller (@markknoller) February 22, 2017 
Yesterday the Anne Frank Center released a statement blasting Trump for not doing enough to condemn anti-Semitism––something Sean Spicer pushed back on ––but today they posted another statement praising Pence: WHAT WE WAITED FOR – FINALLY! Thank you @WhiteHouse and @VP Pence for finally acting against #Antisemitism today. pic.twitter.com/gXrhPNdtbV 
You can watch a clip of Pence’s remarks at the cemetery above, via CNN. 
[ image via screengrab ]
